page.title: 17ECOLOGY
page.content:
Local people are generally very conscious of the quality of their environment and they express genuine concern for its conservation. This continuing awareness has resulted in the preservation and cultivation of hedgerows, a more careful and considered approach to stubble burning and a better appreciation of the effects of multi-substance crop spraying. This improvement in spraying practice has contributed to the survival of many wild flower species. Most of the elms in the area have, however, succumbed to Dutch Elm disease and have been replaced by oak, ash, or beech.
Established wild life in the area includes rabbits, hares, badgers, stoats, and foxes, together with pheasants, partridges and wild ducks.
